messages.message:
I guess it could be like this (framing in terms of derived fields): field 2 is wanted for extraction (e.g. number of bedrooms). Since we want to validate this field, and the best way to do so would be to validate based on the originally extracted data (the JSON here), field 1, we should derive the result of field 2 from field 1 (as opposed to cleaning the initial extraction to filter the result down to the actual data we want to extract).

I guess the key here is that field 1 is not required for a downstream result, its only a checkpoint that we use for validation of another result. Therefore it makes sense to have the option to not expose it in HR or push it downstream, but to allow its existence to validate the actual field we are interested in.

Currently I can't validate this "number of bedrooms" field based on the original extracted result, which is the issue I have.
Just my thoughts on the problem / possible solutions but let me know if that doesn't make sense!

Just want to call out from a technical perspective â€” we do already support validation rules being able to take in one set of fields as input, but mark the result on a different set of fields (at least on the backend)
